fixes.name: TC_Value
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR __Result = CALCULATE(
    MAX('Data (Complaint Line)'[Value]),
    ALLSELECTED('Data (Complaint Line)')
)
RETURN __Result
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted WINDOW_MAX(MAX([Value])) to a measure that takes the MAX of 'Data (Complaint Line)'[Value] across the current window/selection using ALLSELECTED. WINDOW_MAX over MAX([Value]) is represented by calculating the MAX over the selected set.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The Tableau expression uses a table calculation (WINDOW_MAX), which requires an aggregated/context-aware calculation in Power BI, so it must be a measure.

fixes.name: TC_Start Point
fixes.solution_explanation: Translated RUNNING_SUM([TC_Value]) - [TC_Value] into a measure. RUNNING_SUM is represented by summing [TC_Value] over the current selection (ALLSELECTED) with SUMX, then subtracting the current row's [TC_Value]. Because the original Tableau calculation is a table calculation, the DAX uses ALLSELECTED to approximate the window context.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The Tableau expression uses a table calculation (RUNNING_SUM), which requires an aggregated/context-aware calculation in Power BI, so it must be a measure.
